body: [This list will be modified over time] Free resources: 1. The main source is DOE's website: [http://apps1.eere.energy.gov/buildings/energyplus/weatherdata_about...](http://apps1.eere.energy.gov/buildings/energyplus/weatherdata_about.cfm) [https://www.energyplus.net/weather](https://www.energyplus.net/weather) 2. One building.com is also coming around > ([http://climate.onebuilding.org/](http://climate.onebuilding.org/)). Their data is limited right now but they are working on that and also unlike the first resource the data has been through quality checks. 3. There are a couple of weather files available on EnergyPlus mailing list ([https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/EnergyPlus_Support/files/Meteon...](https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/EnergyPlus_Support/files/Meteonorm_Weather_Files/Asia/)) which are generated by MeteoNorm ([http://meteonorm.com/](http://meteonorm.com/)). Commercial: 4. WeatherAnalytics:  [http://www.weatheranalytics.com/wa/products/data-weather-files/](http://www.weatheranalytics.com/wa/products/data-weather-files/) 5. WhiteBox technologies: [http://weather.whiteboxtechnologies.com](http://weather.whiteboxtechnologies.com) PS: I started a project to plot all these resources on a single [epwmap](http://mostapharoudsari.github.io/epwmap/). #WIP [](http://mostapharoudsari.github.io/epwmap/)
